intro: Pouteria sandwicensis f. puulupensis, commonly known as the Puulupensis Pouteria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The fruit is a smooth, round drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
